data.text: @drasimplegon We are currently experiencing a high volume of requests, and the processing time is estimated to be longer than usual. Please be assured that we will contact you as quickly as possible. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

@drasimplegon If you have booked your ticket through an agency, you have to contact your agency in order to make any alterations to your ticket. Please note that fees may be applied depending on the terms and conditions of your ticket.
@danicicc Once again, we are sorry for the inconvenience.

Visakha Bucha Day, or Vesak Day, celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Gautama Buddha, all of which took place on the same date but in different years. It takes place every full moon day of the 6th lunar month, which falls on 6 May this year. https://t.co/fMJzU4T4hw

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: @mylesfdo We are sorry for the inconvenience. Our London office is now closed due to COVID-19 pandemic. If you already contacted them via email, they will reply to you soon.

@GlennConnley Greetings, Glenn, we would like to inform you that refunds can be made by contacting any THAI ticketing office in your city of departure city at https://t.co/p86rp7UJpR. That will depend on the terms and conditions of your ticket.

@Kiran26061 If you have booked your ticket through an agency, you have to contact your agency who issued the tickets and completed the payment in their system. They will coordinate with the airlines directly for this case. Sorry for the inconvenience.
@wurstwaschtl Greetings, could you please repeat your statement in English?

@mylesfdo As we are a social media team, we cannot specify the time of each replying issue via email. Please contact our THAI Contact Center at +662-356-1111 (24 hours) and press 911 for English assistance or send an email to contact@service.thaiairways.com
@mylesfdo If there are any updates, they will reply to you soon.
@ShrutiS91737813 Please contact your agency regarding the issue. The travel agency will coordinate with the airlines directly for this case. Sorry for the inconvenience.

@SHOBHARAJ We are committed to helping all our passengers in the best possible way. Due to high pressure on our customer service, our processing time for refunds is longer than normal. Rest assured that they will be in touch once they are able to. Thank you.
@mylesfdo Once again, we are sorry for the inconvenience.

@mylesfdo Hello. Due to the high volume of incoming requests, we seek your kind understanding and patience that our colleagues may take longer than usual to respond to you. Rest assured that they will be in touch once they are able to. Thank you.

@funjabigooner @SandeepMall Due to the large volume of people who sent a refund request, the service waiting period may be slower than usual. We apologize for any inconvenience this opportunity may cause.

@SandeepMall Hello, Sandeep Mall. Due to the high volume of incoming requests, we seek your kind understanding and patience that our colleagues may take longer than usual to respond to you. Rest assured that they will be in touch once they are able to.

Stay Home Stay Supportive 👪

Because support from our family and loved ones is an essential key to help us get through this difficult time together. So let's give each other our love and support every day! 💜

#StayHomeStaySupportive #StayStrongTogether #ThaiAirways #Family https://t.co/dfTyxfXF7A
